page.description: Displays an EditorSet showing the specified Editor in the EditorSet to edit an arbitrary value. Contrast with the *[link:.editorFromControl()@ux component editorFromControl]* method which is used to edit a value in a UX control.

argument.name: UXEditorSet
argument.description: The name of the EditorSet you want to open.

argument.name: UXEditor
argument.description: The name of the Editor within the specified EditorSet to use.

argument.name: valueToEdit
argument.description: The value that you want to edit in the Editor.

argument.name: settingsObject
argument.description: An object with the following defined properties:

property.name: commit
property.description: *[Required]*. A function to call to 'commit' the value when the EditorSet is committed. The 'commit' function gets passed 'value' (the edited value) and 'settings' (settings.state.value is the initial value passed to the editor.) See example below.

page.discussion: Typically used in mobile applications where you want to define special editors (that display in a pop-up window or Panel) to edit some value.
